abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Admin issues record $105 million penalty against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, citing company's failure to complete 23 safety recalls covering more than 11 million vehicles; marks escalation of agency's efforts to investigate and punish automakers that have not done enough to recall and fix defective models.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators on Sunday levied a record penalty against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles for failing to complete 23 safety recalls covering more than 11 million vehicles.

headline.main: Fiat Chrysler Gets Record $105 Million Fine for Safety Issues
headline.print_headline: Fiat Chrysler Fined $105 Million for Failure to Finish Recalls

snippet: Federal regulators on Sunday levied a record penalty against Fiat Chrysler Automobiles for failing to complete 23 safety recalls covering more than 11 million vehicles.
